WRITING.TITLE: "Eating for two" during pregnancy might be a bad idea. Research has shown that gaining too much weight during pregnancy increases the risk of gestational diabetes, high blood pressure, large babies, and delivery by C-section caesarean section.
Children's exposure to secondhand smoke in England has dropped 80% since 1998

Peanuts reduce risk of cancer, dementia, heart attacks and diabetes, according to a new study. People who ate 10g of nuts per day were less likely to die from major diseases, including respiratory disease, neurodegenerative disease, diabetes, cancer and cardiovascular disease.
One in four Baltimore residents live in a food desert, defined as an area more than 1/4 mile from a supermarket, where median household income is at or below 185% of the federal poverty level.
